snippet: The Pentagon on Monday released a report asserting that climate change poses an immediate threat to national security, with increased risks from terrorism, infectious disease, global poverty and food shortages.
abstract: Pentagon releases report asserting that climate change poses an immediate threat to national security, with increased risks from terrorism, infectious disease, global poverty and food shortages; lays out road map showing how military will adapt to rising sea levels, more violent storms and widespread droughts.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon on Monday released a report asserting that climate change poses an immediate threat to national security, with increased risks from terrorism, infectious disease, global poverty and food shortages.

headline.main: Pentagon Signals Security Risks of Climate Change
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Signals Security Risks of Climate Change

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
